I built a powerful real-time edge terminal specifically for @Polymarket - multi-timeframe dashboard covering all coins! (100% FREE & fully open-source)

In one sentence: This Python bot gives you live alpha on Polymarketâ€™s Up/Down crypto binaries by fusing real-time Binance order flow, current Polymarket probabilities, and multi-TF technical analysis.

Spot mispricings fast - where the market odds havenâ€™t yet caught up to momentum, aggressive delta, or strong signals. 
Perfect for lightning-fast 15-minute scalps (markets resolve every 15 min with constant repricing) or cleaner swings on 1h / 4h / daily horizons.
Pure decision-support tool - no auto-trading, just sharp, actionable insight delivered straight to your terminal.

> Coins covered: BTC, ETH, SOL, XRP 
> Timeframes: 15m, 1h, 4h, daily - All 16 market combinations are live and heavily traded on Polymarket (especially the 15m contracts - ultra-fast flips)

Features at a glance: 

> Streams live trades + full order book from Binance > Pulls real-time Up/Down prices & depth via Polymarket WebSocket 
> Computes 11+ indicators on the fly 
> Rolls everything up into a clear BULLISH / BEARISH / NEUTRAL bias score + probability estimate per timeframe 
> Displays a clean, colorful, auto-refreshing terminal dashboard

Order-book signals: 

> OBI (imbalance)
> visible buy/sell walls
> liquidity depth (0.1% / 0.5% / 1.0%)
> net flow & volume
> CVD (across 1m/3m/5m windows)
> 1m delta
> Volume Profile + POC

Technical indicators: 
> RSI (14)
> MACD (12/26/9) + signal line + histogram
> VWAP
> EMA 5 / EMA 20 cross
>Heikin-Ashi candle streak count

Important: 
this is NOT an auto-trading bot. It highlights where Polymarket odds are lagging real Binance order-flow and multi-timeframe TA - giving you an edge on 15m scalping, 1â€“4h momentum trades, and daily directional confirmation.

Built with: 
Python (asyncio + Rich/Textual for a slick CLI look) One-line start: 
python https://t.co/ATX2BzEFRH Refreshes every few seconds Completely free & open-source â†’ GitHub repo

Want access? Like + RT + drop a reply or quote below - Iâ€™ll DM you the GitHub link

Donâ€™t miss the edge - especially on those 15-minute markets that flip every quarter hour. Seeing all timeframes at once is real alpha.

Hereâ€™s to green candles and fat PnL!

2026-02-12.author: krajekis
2026-02-12.text_en:
The Hidden Power of Time in @Polymarket BTC 15m Trading [Full Guide]

On Polymarket, you must decide:  
Will BTC close UP or DOWN in the next 15 minutes?

Most traders donâ€™t lose because of strategy.  
They lose because they ignore time.  
Time determines edge.

Key: TIME â€“ BTC Trading Sessions (EST)

â€¢ WEEKDAYS:

1) Asian Session (7:00 PM â€“ 3:00 AM EST)

Market State: 
Compression / Range / Low volatility  
This is mean-reversion time.

Blueprint:
Use VWAP + RSI(14) + low ATR + volume + MACD divergence  
- Price stretched above flat VWAP + RSI overbought + weak volume â†’ Choose DOWN  
- Price stretched below VWAP + RSI oversold + weak selling â†’ Choose UP  
- Low ATR confirms compression  
- Ignore MACD crossovers  
- Only trade MACD divergence: Higher high in price + lower high in MACD â†’ DOWN  
  Lower low in price + higher low in MACD â†’ UP  
- Avoid breakouts. Avoid mid-range trades.  

Edge: Fade extremes.

2) London Kill Zone (2:00 AM â€“ 5:00 AM EST) 

Market State: 
Expansion / Liquidity sweep  
Asian high or low often gets attacked first.

Blueprint:
Use Volume spike + EMA21 + VWAP reclaim + rising ATR + MACD acceleration  
- Sweep high + strong red 15m close below VWAP & EMA21 + expanding bearish MACD histogram â†’ Choose DOWN  
- Sweep low + strong green close above VWAP & EMA21 + expanding bullish MACD histogram â†’ Choose UP  
- Volume must expand  
- ATR must increase  
- MACD histogram expansion > simple crossover  
- Never enter during sweep candle. Enter after confirmation close.

Edge: Trade after liquidity grab.

3) NY Open / Overlap (7:00 AM â€“ 11:00 AM EST)  

Market State:
 Maximum volatility / Momentum phase  
Large moves happen here.

Blueprint:
Use VWAP slope + EMA21/EMA50 alignment + high volume + high ATR + MACD momentum  
- Strong 15m close breaking structure + volume expansion â†’ Follow direction  
- Break above level + MACD above zero expanding â†’ UP  
- Break below level + MACD below zero expanding â†’ DOWN  
- Price above rising VWAP + EMA21 > EMA50 â†’ bullish bias  
- Price below falling VWAP â†’ bearish bias  
- ATR must confirm expansion  
- If MACD histogram contracts after strong move â†’ potential short-term reversal  
- Wait for candle close. Never click mid-spike.

Edge: Confirmation + aligned momentum.

4) London Close (10:00 AM â€“ 12:00 PM EST)

Market State: 
Exhaustion / Slowdown  
Momentum fades. Wicks increase.

Blueprint:
Use RSI divergence + VWAP stretch + ATR contraction + MACD histogram slowdown  
- Extended move far from VWAP + rejection candle â†’ Fade move  
- Price makes marginal new high but MACD histogram shrinks â†’ Choose DOWN  
- Price makes marginal new low but histogram shrinks â†’ Choose UP  
- Decreasing ATR confirms volatility contraction  
- Reduce size in choppy conditions.

Edge: Fade overextended trends.

â€¢ WEEKENDS:

Market State: 
Thin liquidity / Lower institutional participation  
More fake breakouts. Less follow-through.

Blueprint:
Use VWAP mean reversion + strict volume filter + ATR + cautious MACD divergence  
- Breakout without volume expansion â†’ Ignore  
- Price stretched far from VWAP inside range â†’ Fade  
  Upper stretch + weak momentum â†’ DOWN  
  Lower stretch + weak momentum â†’ UP  
- Smaller ATR = smaller expected move  
- Ignore MACD crossovers; only use divergence as confirmation  
- Trade smaller size.

Edge: Patience + reduced risk.

Indicator Hierarchy:
1. Time (session behavior)  
2. Volume  
3. VWAP  
4. ATR  
5. EMA structure  
6. MACD  
7. RSI  

Final Rule: 
- Asian â†’ Fade extremes  
- London â†’ Trade post-sweep momentum  
- NY â†’ Trade confirmed acceleration  
- Close â†’ Fade exhaustion  
- Weekend â†’ Trade small and selective   

15m Execution Checklist Before Clicking UP or DOWN:

- Which session is active?
- Compression or expansion?
- Range extreme or breakout level?
- Volume confirming move?
- ATR expanding or contracting?
- MACD accelerating or slowing?
- Did the 15m candle close strong?

If unclear â†’ no trade.

Time defines probability.  
Indicators confirm it.  
Then you click UP or DOWN.

2026-02-15.author: browomo
2026-02-15.text_en:
My entire Polymarket strategy right now is Ctrl+C on a wallet making $20K a month and Ctrl+V on my account.

Yeah. I know how that sounds.

6 months ago I would have closed the chat on anyone who said this. Probably blocked them too.

But here is where I am: last month, +$2,700. Trading decisions I made: 0.

For context, my best month of manual trading was $580. And that took 3-4 hours a day.

Let me back up.

For 6 months I was a "real trader." Charts on 2 monitors. 3 Discord alpha groups. NOAA weather data at 2 AM because someone said temperature markets were free money.

Spreadsheets tracking 40 wallets. Every thread read. An opinion on every market.

Average month: somewhere between $400 and "I would rather not say."

I was very busy. Just not very profitable.

Then something clicked. Not an insight about markets. An insight about me.

The wallets I was tracking, the ones pulling $15K-$30K a month, had data pipelines, sub-second execution, and models I could not replicate in a year of trying.

I was not competing with other retail traders. I was competing with infrastructure.

You do not outrun a car. You get in the car.

So I stopped. Stopped picking markets. Stopped reading forecasts. Stopped setting 3 AM alarms for data drops.

Found 3 wallets with 90+ day track records and consistent returns. Not the flashy ones posting $3M screenshots on Twitter. The boring ones pulling 4-6% weekly on liquid markets.

Connected automatic copying. 1 evening. Maybe 15 minutes of actual setup.

That was 5 weeks ago.

1st week I checked the dashboard every 2 hours. Old habits. 2nd week, once a day. Now I check maybe every 5 or 6 days.

Trades execute on their own. I do not choose markets. I do not analyze odds. I do not decide position sizes.

5 weeks in: +$3,100 total. Same capital that would have made me $300-400 doing it manually. Same money. Different operator.

Or rather, no operator.

I did not make a single trading decision. That was the whole point.

The logic is short: top wallets have speed, data, and execution you and I will never have. You can not beat them. But you can stand next to them and do exactly what they do, at roughly the same time, in the same markets.

The tool I use: @pmx_trade

1 evening. 15 minutes. 0 decisions since: https://t.co/141s8ehGfe 

6 months of charts taught me less than 1 evening of copying.

Turns out the smartest move in trading is not trading at all.

BlackRock manages $10 trillion. This wallet on Polymarket manages $50K and makes $100K/month with a strategy their quant team would laugh at.

He looks at crypto markets on Polymarket, picks price levels where the outcome is already 70-90% likely, buys Yes shares for 70-90 cents and waits.

BlackRock has 20,000 employees and offices in 30 countries. This guy has a laptop.

Most people on Polymarket are trying to predict the future. 

He is not predicting anything. He is collecting what the present already owes him.

Would you rather mass hire PhDs to find alpha, or buy what is already in front of everyone and just do it more than anyone else?
